knowledgeGraph.title: Apple
knowledgeGraph.description: Apple Inc. is an American multinational corporation and technology company headquartered and incorporated in Cupertino, California, in Silicon Valley. It is best known for its consumer electronics, software, and services.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is Apple Inc stand for?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: It was incorporated as Apple Computer, Inc. in January 1977, and sales of its computers, including the Apple II , saw significant momentum and revenue growth for the company. "Inc." is the abbreviation for incorporated. A corporation is a separate legal entity from the person or people forming it.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What does the 'Inc.' in Apple Inc. mean? - Quora

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is Apple called Apple or Apple Inc.?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Apple Inc., originally Apple Computer, Inc., is a multinational corporation that creates and markets consumer electronics and attendant computer software, and is a digital distributor of media content. Apple's core product lines are the iPhone smartphone, iPad tablet computer, and the Mac personal computer.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: History of Apple Inc. - Wikipedia

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Who owns Apple Inc?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Apple (AAPL) Ownership Overview The ownership structure of Apple (AAPL) stock is a mix of institutional, retail, and individual investors. Approximately 49.23% of the company's stock is owned by Institutional Investors, 0.06% is owned by Insiders, and 50.71% is owned by Public Companies and Individual Investors.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Who owns Apple? AAPL Stock Ownership - TipRanks.com

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is Apple Inc known for?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Apple Inc. (formerly Apple Computer Inc.) is an American computer and consumer electronics company famous for creating the iPhone, iPad and Macintosh computers. Apple is one of the largest companies globally with a market cap of more than $3 trillion.
